Module nstaley.inventorysystem
Package nstaley.inventorysystem

Class ModifyPartFormController

java.lang.Object
nstaley.inventorysystem.ModifyPartFormController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyPartFormController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This Class is the controller for the modify part screen. When the screen is initialized the text fields are populated with the data for the part that was selected to be modified. The user is able to change any of this data except the part id number. The part then can either be saved, or the user can cancel modifying the part and return to the main screen.
Author:
Nicholas Staley

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Method to initialize the modify part screen. This loads all the part data for the part the user wants to modify into the text fields, and sets the radio button.

    • modifyInHouseSelected

      Parameters:

    • backToMain

      public void backToMain(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Method to cancel modifying a part and return to the main screen. RUNTIME/LOGIC ERROR - After modifying an in house part, the program would always show the last in house part that had been either modified or had been selected to be modified. I found that this was being caused by the initializer first checking to see if there was an in house part to be modified, and once one had been modified it was staying because it is static and would have to be manually removed when you left the screen. This was done by setting the inHousePartModify and outsourcedPartModify both to null when either the cancel button or save button is clicked, so there would be no remaining data to cause the error.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • setInHousePartModify

      public static void setInHousePartModify(InHouse partToModify)
      Method to set the part to be modified when it is an in house part.
      Parameters:

    • setOutsourcedPartModify

    • saveModify

      public void saveModify(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Method to save the Modified part, has exception handling to prevent the program from crashing if invalid data is entered into the text fields.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Save button clicked
      Throws:
      IOException - Throws IOException if the file can not be loaded.

    • setModifyIndex
